definition: Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: He may have been lit, and can try to give him some Qinghuo eat food.
sentences.chinese: 他可能是上火了，可以嘗試給他喫一些清火的食物。

sentences.english: Objective:To establish the method of determining the content of barbering hydrochloride in Sanhuang Qinghuo capsules.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立三黃清火片中鹽酸小檗鹼含量的測定方法。

sentences.english: Practising this kind of Qigong can also result in clear vision and refreshment.
sentences.chinese: 做這種氣功，也能達到清火明目，怡神醒腦的目的。

definition: to alleviate fever (medicine)/to clear internal heat (Chinese medicine)
to moisten the lungs/to make expectoration easy (medicine)
to nourish one's skin/to maintain a youthful appearance
